body:

[#889]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/889
[#981]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/981

title: iqhttp: add `HttpsClient::{add_header, headers_mut}`
body:
Adds support for configuring HTTP headers to send as part of the request.

Uses `hyper::HeaderMap` as the internal data structure for headers, making them yet another thin wrapper around `hyper`.

This functionality existed somewhat before, but as a crate-internal feature only. This commit exposes it as a first-class feature.

title: Fix MSRV documentation
body:
Updates all stale docs to the current MSRV of 1.56.

Closes #951

title: build(deps): bump tendermint from 0.23.0 to 0.23.3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [tendermint](https://github.com/informalsystems/tendermint-rs) from 0.23.0 to 0.23.3.
Release notes

Sourced from tendermint's releases.

v0.23.3

:book: CHANGELOG

v0.23.2

:book: CHANGELOG

v0.23.1

:book: CHANGELOG

Changelog

Sourced from tendermint's changelog.

v0.23.3

Dec 20, 2021

Here we mainly attempt to provide a short-term workaround for #1021 by catering for both possible forms of JSON serialization for public keys.

IMPROVEMENTS

  • [tendermint] Hash is implemented for tendermint::Time (#1054)

WORKAROUNDS

  • [tendermint-rpc] Allow deserialization of public keys from validator updates from block_results endpoint in multiple JSON formats until this is fixed in Tendermint (#1021)

v0.23.2

Dec 7, 2021

This release focuses on the removal of chrono as our primary dependency for dealing with time, and replaces it with the time crate.

This is necessarily a breaking change, but is released as v0.23.2 as per our current versioning scheme.

BREAKING CHANGES

  • [tendermint] Reform tendermint::Time (#1030):
    • The struct content is made private.
    • The range of acceptable values is restricted to years 1-9999 (as reckoned in UTC).
    • Removed conversions from/to chrono::DateTime<chrono::Utc>.
    • Changes in error variants: removed TimestampOverflow, replaced with TimestampNanosOutOfRange; removed ChronoParse, replaced with TimeParse.
  • [tendermint-rpc] Use OffsetDateTime and Date types provided by the time crate in query operands instead of their chrono counterparts. (#1030)

IMPROVEMENTS

  • [tendermint] Deprecated signature::ED25519_SIGNATURE_SIZE

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 4a48416 Release v0.23.3 (#1066)
  • 7e81efb Bump getrandom to 0.2 (#1062) (#1065)
  • e562d4d rpc: Add temporary fix and tests for block_results serialization (#1061)
  • 8354fec Bump k256 to v0.10 (#1059) (#1060)
  • c6ffe1b Derive Hash on tendermint::Time (#1054) (#1055)
  • c31d8cb Remove unnecessary cdylib artifacts from the build (#1052) (#1056)
  • 8aabc22 Release v0.23.2 (#1043)
  • 1a7eafc Expunge more uses of time >0.3.2 API (#1050)
  • dbdb71c Roll back time-rs dependency and remove methods that require version 0.3.5 (#...
  • 49d3783 Attempt GA branch pattern match for version-specific branches (#1044) (#1045)

title: Remove `anomaly` and `zeroize`
body:
- `anomaly` has been deprecated
- `zeroize` has been moved

This removes some short-lived notices about these two crates

title: anomaly: retire crate
body:
According to: https://crates.io/crates/anomaly/reverse_dependencies

...the only notable crate still using `anomaly` is the `yubihsm` crate, which just vendored the relevant functionality it was using:

https://github.com/iqlusioninc/yubihsm.rs/pull/264

There are better alternatives for Rust error handling available now, especially in the "error context library" space. So this commit retires `anomaly`, removing its source code and leaving a README.md in its place temporarily.

title: Remove `tai64` crate
body:
It's been relocated to:

https://github.com/RustCrypto/formats/tree/master/tai64

title: bip32: decouple from `hkd32`
body:
The `bip32` crate only relies on `hkd32` for its BIP39 implementation.

There are features it'd be nice to add to BIP39 which are made difficult by the `hkd32` dependency, for example supporting shorter mnemonics.

This commit decouples the two crates, making `bip32` largely self-contained.

title: zeroize: move repository to new location
body:
This commit removes the source code to `zeroize`, which has been moved to a new repository:

https://github.com/RustCrypto/utils/tree/master/zeroize

title: Remove `harp` crate
body:
The `yubihsm` crate was the last user, and this commit vendored the code into that crate itself:

https://github.com/iqlusioninc/yubihsm.rs/pull/259

body:

body:
Add additional tests to prevent #876 from happening again. I also moved the `struct`s inside the test functions to improve the code.

This will conflict with #900, I will handle the rebase ofc.

title: Implement `#[zeroize(skip)]`
body:
If any more tests are desired feel free to hit me up.

Fixes #899 and #651.

title: build(deps): bump tendermint from 0.22.0 to 0.23.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [tendermint](https://github.com/informalsystems/tendermint-rs) from 0.22.0 to 0.23.0.
Release notes

Sourced from tendermint's releases.

v0.23.0

:book: CHANGELOG

Changelog

Sourced from tendermint's changelog.

v0.23.0

Oct 27, 2021

The main changes in this release involve upgrading to Prost v0.9 and some foundational changes to prepare for no_std support for some of our crates.

One of the main no_std-related changes in this release was to break out configuration-related data structures from the tendermint crate into their own crate (tendermint-config) as these structures depend on other crates which do not yet support no_std.

BREAKING CHANGES

  • Upgraded Prost to the official v0.9 release to finally resolve the security issue introduced by v0.7 (#925)
  • [tendermint, tendermint-config] The tendermint::config module has now been broken out into its own crate (tendermint- config) to help towards facilitating no_std compatibility (#983)
  • [tendermint] The tendermint::node::info::OtherInfo::rpc_address field type has been changed from tendermint::net::Address to String toward facilitating no_std compatibility (#983)
  • [tendermint] The tendermint::node::info::ListenAddress::to_net_address method was replaced with a simple as_str method toward facilitating no_std compatibility ([#983](https://github.com/informalsystems/tendermint- rs/issues/983))

FEATURES

  • [tendermint-rpc] Add support for the /block_search RPC endpoint. See https://docs.tendermint.com/master/rpc/\#/Info/block_search for details (#832)
Commits
  • 858b577 Release v0.23.0 (#1013)
  • 5bf6bae Use core and alloc crates for no_std compatibility (Take 2) (#993)
  • ce55f22 Update to official Prost v0.9 (#1011)
  • 7637b2f Bump version to 0.23.0-internal (#1009)
  • 1ab5e86 Move out tendermint::config to tendermint-config crate (#986)
  • e3e4c88 meta: Adopt forked prost crates (#1005)
  • aee72bd Use chrono::DateTime instead of std::time::SystemTime (#994)
  • 7239848 tools: Add block_search method to RPC probe (#1002)
  • e1c158f ci: Build and check tools (#997)
  • 4f1c553 tools: Fix block_search endpoint integration tests (#999)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

body:
### Changed
- Bump `tendermint` crate from 0.20.0 to 0.21.0 ([#820])
- Rust 2021 edition upgrade; MSRV 1.56+ ([#889])

[#889]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/889

title: Implement `Zeroize` for `NonZeroX`
body:
Implements `Zeroize` for all `NonZero` integer types in the standard library. I decided to set them to `0xFFF...`.

Fixes #891.

title: zeroize_derive v1.1.1
body:
- Backport #847 but with a 1.47+ MSRV

Closes #880

title: zeroize v1.4.2
body:
### Added
- Derive `Default` on `Zeroizing` ([#870])

[#870]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/870

title: zeroize_derive v1.2.0
body:
### Changed
- Bump MSRV to 1.51+ ([#755])
- Reject `#[zeroize(drop)]` on struct/enum fields, enum variants ([#847])

[#755]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/755
[#847]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/847

title: zeroize: derive `Default` on `Zeroizing`
body:
Simplifies initialization of a `Zeroizing` type to its default value.

Closes #849.

title: zeroize: modernize docs
body: Uses rustdoc's linking convention to link to types/functions

title: bip32 v0.2.2
body:
### Changed
- Avoid `AsRef` ambiguity with `generic-array` ([#859])

[#859]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/859

title: Resolve a build issue with bip32 when there are competing versions of generic-array in the dependency tree.
body:
As explained in #858, using GenericArray::as_slice is more deterministic for the compiler when it is working against conflicting versions of generic-array; at least, that is the theory behind why `as_ref` without any type annotations is causing complier confusion, given the wider set of `AsRef` impls on `GenericArray` in 0.14 vs. 0.12.

I think regardless of my personal build issue, this update to `as_slice` is safe and could be argued as a better fit.

title: reject #[zeroize(drop)] on struct/enum fields, enum variants
body:
Reject the #[zeroize(drop)] attribute on struct and enum fields, as users may be missing a zeroizing Drop implementation
they expected to be generated for them.

For consistency, the attribute is now rejected on enum variants as well, which was previously accepted and generated a
Drop impl for the entire enum, but which may not be what users may have expected, as it could be interpreted that such
an attribute would zeroize only the variants containing the attribute on Drop.

Closes #837.

title: signatory v0.23.2
body:
### Added
- `ed25519::VerifyingKey::to_bytes` ([#834])

[#834]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/834

title: canonical-path: fix tests
body: This lint is breaking the build

title: build(deps): bump tendermint from 0.20.0 to 0.21.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [tendermint](https://github.com/informalsystems/tendermint-rs) from 0.20.0 to 0.21.0.
Release notes

Sourced from tendermint's releases.

v0.21.0

:book: CHANGELOG

Changelog

Sourced from tendermint's changelog.

v0.21.0

Jul 20, 2021

This release introduces several minor breaking changes (see below), among other improvements, that clean up a few RPC-related data structures and ensure better correctness of the TrustThresholdFraction data structure when constructing and deserializing it.

A security issue was reported in prost v0.7, and we attempted to upgrade to v0.8, but we are still awaiting one bug fix in v0.8 before we can upgrade. The moment that is fixed in prost, we will upgrade to v0.8 and provide another tendermint-rs release.

BREAKING CHANGES

  • [tendermint-rpc] Remove the TmEvent and Attribute structs and replace them with their equivalent domain types from the tendermint crate (#918)
  • [tendermint] The TrustThresholdFraction struct can now only be constructed by way of its new constructor. Deserialization also now makes use of this constructor, facilitating better validation. The numerator and denominator fields can be accessed (read-only) via their respective methods, since the fields are now private. (#924)

BUG FIXES

  • [tendermint] Update Genesis for Tendermint v.0.34.x (#917)
  • [tendermint-rpc] Fix bug where NewBlock events emitted by Tendermint could not be parsed because of a missing field (#930)

IMPROVEMENTS

  • [tendermint-proto] Regenerate the Rust equivalents of the Tendermint Protobuf structures for Tendermint v0.34.9 (#871)
  • [tendermint-rpc] Add PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord and Hash trait bounds to the RPC URL types (#919)
  • [tendermint-rpc] Propagate JSON-RPC errors through the Rust subscription (#932)
Commits
  • d8e18c6 Release v0.21.0 (#935)
  • f46cf0f Ensure correct TrustThresholdFraction construction (#934)
  • 370dc02 Propagate JSON-RPC errors through the Rust subscription (#929)
  • a93a215 Specify default value for tendermint::block::Size (#931)
  • 1a7c160 Temporarily revert #926 (#928)
  • a748118 Deduplicate RPC domain types (#922)
  • 1efe42c Update prost and prost-types to version 0.8 (#926)
  • 7b84781 Add equality/ordering/hash trait bounds to RPC URL types (#921)
  • c8b97aa update Tendermint genesis (#917)
  • d9668d3 Rebuild Protobuf data structures for Tendermint v0.34.9 (#920)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

### Added
- `Algorithm::EcdsaNistP256` and `Algorithm::Ed25519` variants ([#817])

title: signatory: `Algorithm` enum improvements
body:
The `Algorithm` enum was previously missing `EcdsaNistP256` and `Ed25519` variants, as it wasn't integral to how the keyring worked.

This commit adds those variants, and also uses `Algorithm` as the one way to parse PKCS#8 AlgorithmIdentifiers, ensuring that in the future additional algorithms will always need to be added to it.

title: signatory v0.23.0
body:
This release is effectively a complete rewrite of Signatory with a brand-new API, and as such contains changes too numerous to document. For that reason, we are pushing the reset button on the changelog.

It still provides the same original set of functionality, including ECDSA and Ed25519 signatures, but temporarily drops support for P-384 and hardware-backed digital signature providers.

The plan is to eventually add this functionality back. The new implementation is fundamentally built on the same original codebase, but refactored and extracted into other Rust crates. Given that, we hope to achieve feature parity with the original implementation quickly.

title: signatory: Ed25519 support
body: Adds support for Ed25519 signing, verification, and keyrings, using `ed25519-dalek` as the backing implementation.

title: zeroize v1.4.1
body:
### Added
- Implement Zeroize for `[MaybeUninit<Z>]` ([#793])

[#793]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/793

body: hardcoding `hyper` to v0.14.10 to see if that fixes version glob in [ deps.rs badge]( https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/808).

title: zeroize v1.4.0
body:
*NOTE: This release includes an MSRV bump to Rust 1.51. Please use `zeroize = "1.3.0"` if you would like to support older Rust versions.*

### Added
- Use const generics to impl `Zeroize` for `[Z; N]`; MSRV 1.51 ([#794])
- `Zeroizing::clone_from` now zeroizes the destination before cloning ([#801])

[#794]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/794
[#801]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/801

title: Zeroizing::clone_from now zeroizes the destination before cloning
body: Commits from #736, rebased on current `main`

title: signatory: ECDSA/P-256 support
body: Adds a `nistp256` crate feature which provides feature-gated support for ECDSA signatures using NIST's P-256 elliptic curve.

title: Finish spiking out ECDSA/secp256k1 support + integration test
body: Also adds a `KeyHandle` enum which abstracts over the key's algorithm.

title: Use const generics to implement Zeroize for Arrays
body:
IIUC after https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/755 the MSRV of Zeroize is 1.51, which is the version that rust stabilized  the "minimum const generics" feature (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/RELEASES.md#version-1510-2021-03-25).

So I think there's no more reason to use a macro and restrict ourselves to arrays with length up to 64.

title: Implement Zeroize for `[MaybeUninit<Z>]`
body:
Implementing Zeroize for `[MaybeUninit<Z>]` is very helpful IMHO, because it allows to zeroize any custom heap allocated objects by just constructing a slice of `MaybeUninit`(as some of the buffer might not be initialized) and calling `zeroize()` on it.

I also changed the Vec implementation to zero out the full capacity and not just the uninitialized part, because I don't see any difference between the initialized and the unintialized, if the data in the buffer is secret then we should make sure we zero out all of the buffer.

The downside is that if the Vec contains a primitive(say `Vec<u8>`) then we'll zero the used space twice, so I can see arguments against it (currently the only time I can think this will matter is in Vecs with another indirection, like `Vec<Box<Z>>` or `Vec<&Z>`, and then is there a point in zeroing out those pointers?)

So if people disagree on the 2nd commit I can drop it and leave only the first commit.

title: signatory: add `FsKeyStore::import`
body: Support for importing PKCS#8 keys into `KeyRing`s.

title: signatory: docs.rs config
body: Uses `doc_cfg` on https://docs.rs to annotate which crate features are required to use specific parts of the library.

title: signatory: add `FsKeyStore::create_or_open`
body:
Adds a function for creating a keystore if it doesn't exist, or opening an existing one if it does.

Underneath it eagerly attempts to open the keystore, and then handles errors by trying to create it (then open it again).

title: bip32: doc fixup
body: Deriving child `XPub`s from a parent `XPub` was implemented in #772

title: bip32 v0.2.0
body:
### Added
- Non-hardened derivation support with `XPub::derive_child` ([#772])

### Changed
- Rename `XPrv::derive_child_from_seed` => `XPrv::derive_from_path` ([#773])

[#772]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/772
[#773]: https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/pull/773

title: bip32: rename `XPrv::derive_child_from_seed` to `::derive_from_path`
body:
The previous name was both long and somewhat confusing as `XPrv::new` also accepts a seed (and generates the root key).

The notable thing about `derive_from_path` is that it accepts a `DerivationPath` as an argument, so the name has been changed to both be shorter and reflect that it derives using a path.

title: bip32: add `(Extended)PublicKey::derive_child`
body:
Adds a `derive_child` method to the `PublicKey` trait which can be used for computing a child xpub from a parent xpub (i.e. non-hardened derivation support)

Additionally adds a corresponding `ExtendedPublicKey::derive_child` method which wraps up this derivation.

title: build(deps): bump tendermint from 0.19.0 to 0.20.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [tendermint](https://github.com/informalsystems/tendermint-rs) from 0.19.0 to 0.20.0.
Release notes

Sourced from tendermint's releases.

v0.20.0

:book: CHANGELOG

Changelog

Sourced from tendermint's changelog.

v0.20.0

Jun 22, 2021

This release's number is bumped up to v0.20.0 due to two minor breaking changes in our public APIs (see the breaking changes section below for details).

Also, since nobody was really making use of the Light Node, we decided to remove its crate from the repo for now. If anyone needs it back, please contact us and we'll restore it (although, we are considering migrating any and all binaries to their own repositories in the future to separate library-level concerns from operational ones).

The tendermint-p2p crate is still undergoing significant expansion (thanks to @​xla and @​melekes). A lot's been done and we're in the process of finalizing this new architecture, which will form the basis for future work towards building more Tendermint nodes in Rust. More on this in future releases.

Other than that, this release mainly contains various small bug fixes, improvements and dependency updates.

BREAKING CHANGES

  • [tendermint-p2p] Remove superfluous module name suffixes in p2p::error (#898)
  • [tendermint] Rename time::Time::to_rfc3339 to as_rfc3339 to be consistent with Rust's self reference conventions (#910)

BUG FIXES

  • [tendermint-abci,tendermint-rpc] Fix DeliverTx response deserialization issues with gas_wanted and gas_used fields (#876)
  • [tendermint] Update TendermintConfig for Tendermint v.0.34.x (#897)
  • [tendermint] Better handling of optional values in TendermintConfig (#908)

IMPROVEMENTS

  • [tendermint-light-client] Replaced tempdir dev dependency (deprecated) with tempfile (#851)
  • Updated the changelog process to use unclog format and unblock the PR merge process (#891).
  • [tendermint] Changed tendermint::public_key::Secp256k1 to be an alias of k256::ecdsa::VerifyingKey (#900)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 21ef18f Release v0.20.0 (#912)
  • c305efd Unpin Tokio version and fix docs test in CI (#914)
  • bb828d2 p2p: Bump chacha20poly1305 dependency (#913)
  • 1b3464e Fix latest clippy assertion failures (#910)
  • 795e3bd Tendermint config handle optional values + fix net::Address Display (#908)
  • 05da904 p2p: Propose transport agnostic abstractions (#904)
  • f6f8720 tendermint: Add TryFrom for node::Id from PublicKey (#903)
  • b262d0b p2p: break out tests into separate crate (#898)
  • 865fef4 tendermint: use k256::ecdsa::VerifyingKey as Secp256k1 key (#900)
  • 2974b60 Revert flume pin and specify working version 0.10.7 (#902)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: bip32 v0.0.1
body:
This is a tendermint-rs compatible prerelease which omits #759.

After merging that, we can cut a real initial release.

title: hkd32 v0.6.0-pre
body:
This release is compatible with the current `tendermint` crate, and does not include #759.

We'll merge that after this prerelease.

title: Bump `k256` to v0.9; `rand_core` to v0.6
body:
We were previously keeping these back to ensure compatibility with `tendermint-rs` for use with `bip32`, however one of the interesting features of `bip32` is that it's generic, which means we can still use it via simple newtype wrappers that provide the current implementation.

This commit bumps these dependencies so we can release with the latest versions.

title: bip32: secp256k1-ffi feature
body:
Adds support for deriving keys using the `secp256k1` crate, which wraps the Bitcoin Core libsecp256k1 C library.

Additionally, this commit fills out the remaining BIP32 test vectors, namely Test Vector 1 and Test Vector 4.

title: Switch to `resolver = "2"`; MSRV 1.51
body:
This resolver prevents build and dev dependencies from being mixed into the actual crate dependencies, which makes it easier to develop/test crates which work on `no_std` platforms.

More info: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2021/03/25/Rust-1.51.0.html#cargos-new-feature-resolver

title: bip32: make "alloc" an optional feature (heapless support)
body:
The only thing that presently requires `alloc` is `DerivationPath`.

This commit makes `DerivationPath` optional, and feature-gated under a newly added `alloc` feature.

Additionally, this commit tests `no_std` builds of both `bip32` and `hkd32`, including builds on WASM.

title: bip32: `ChildNumber` and `DerivationPath` improvements
body:
- Adds `Display` impls to both
- Adds additional constructor methods for `ChildNumber`
- Adds `Extend` and `IntoIterator` impls for `DerivationPath`

title: bip32: extract `ExtendedKeyAttrs` type
body:
Extracts a type for carrying around attributes/metadata related to extended keys, which includes:

- depth
- parent fingerprint
- child number
- chain code

title: bip32: refactor `extended_key` module
body: Moves `ExtendedPrivateKey`/`ExtendedPublicKey` under the `extended_key` module, keeping it private and re-exporting them at the toplevel.

title: bip32: add PublicKey/ExtendedPublicKey and XPub alias
body:
Adds a `PublicKey` trait and uses it as the bound for the associated `PrivateKey::PublicKey` type.

Adds `ExtendedPublicKey`, the extended key analogue of `ExtendedPrivateKey`, and support for serializing/deserializing them to/from `ExtendedKey`, as well as computing it from an `ExtendedPrivateKey`.

When the `secp256k1` feature is enabled, adds an `XPub` alias for an `ExtendedPublicKey` whose `K: PublicKey` is a `k256::ecdsa::VerifyingKey`.

Finally, augments the test vectors in `tests/bip32_vectors.rs` to include `xpub...` strings, and ensures keys are derived and serialized correctly.
